page.title: 15Limestone Hill Mill
page.content: The mill is a listed building.A 100 years ago it was renovated.Then a Mr. {Wrigglesworth}and his family moved in. The building is made of Roche Abbey Quarry Stone.{Today}there is a lot more water than ever before.This comes from a nearby Pit where a well was found.The colliery water is cleaned. The waterwheel is dove-tailed into straight walls.It has 6 buckets which are{undershot.}When the wheel was at work it sounded like horses'hoofs.Its diameter is 7m and its width is 3m. The cogs used,alternate{iron with wood to prevent friction and wear.Upstairs there is a millstone and some equipment for starting the wheel.On the third floor there is only a chain for lifting the sacks and some grain. The{atmosphere}was of{'time'}having remained stationary.
